instruction: Lessons begin with the home keys for the left hands: '**ASDF**' Place your left hand letter finger over the '**A**' key; ring finger over '**S**'; middle finger over '**D**'; and index finger over '**F**'. Keep the fingers curved, relaxed and poised just over the home keys.
description: Home row - Learn the left hand home row keys

instruction: The next lesson introduces a new home key: '**J**'. Use the index finger of the right hand to strike the '**J**' key. Remember to position your fingers over the home keys and reach from there to all other parts of the keyboard.
description: Home row - Learn the right hand home row keys

instruction: The next lesson introduces a new home key: '**K**'. Use the middle finger of the right hand to strike the '**K**' key. Remember to position your fingers over the home keys and reach from there to all other parts of the keyboard.
description: Home row - Practice all home row keys together

instruction: The next lesson introduces a new home key: '**L**'. Use the ring finger of the right hand to strike the '**L**' key. Remember to position your fingers over the home keys and reach from there to all other parts of the keyboard.
description: Home row - Practice right ring finger for 'l'

instruction: The next lesson introduces a new home key: '**;**'. Use the little finger of the right hand to strike the '**;**' key. Remember to position your fingers over the home keys and reach from there to all other parts of the keyboard.
description: Home row - Practice right litter finger for ';'

instruction: Use your left index finger to strike both the 'F' and 'G' keys, and use your thumb for the space bar
description: Home row - This lesson is for practice right index finger for 'f' and 'g'.

instruction: The next lesson introduces a new home key: '**;**'. Use the little finger of the right hand to strike the '**;**' key. Remember to position your fingers over the home keys and reach from there to all other parts of the keyboard.
description: Home row - This lesson is for practice right index finger for 'f' and 'g'.

instruction: Use your right index finger to strike both the 'J' and 'H' keys, and use your thumb for the space bar
description: Home row - This lesson is for practice right index finger for 'j' and 'h'.

instruction: The next lesson introduces a new home key: '**;**'. Use the little finger of the right hand to strike the '**;**' key. Remember to position your fingers over the home keys and reach from there to all other parts of the keyboard.
description: Home row - This lesson is for practice right index finger for 'j' and 'h'.

instruction: Practice home key with mini test to check the typing skill
description: Mini test of home keys

description: mini test - This lesson is for practice home, up row and low row keys.

instruction: From your letter home row (**ASDF JKL;**), gently stretch your fingers upwards. Your **left index finger handles** **4** and **5**, while your **right index finger** takes **6** and **7**. Your other fingers will reach straight up for their respective numbers: **left pinky for 1, ring for 2, middle for 3**; and on the right, **middle for 8, ring for 9, and pinky for 0**. Always return your fingers to the home row after each keystroke.
description: Number Row - This lesson is for practice number row

instruction: Reach up with your left-hand fingers to type the numbers '1', '2', and '3'. Practice typing the numbers in sequence
description: Number 1, 2, 3, 4

instruction: Reach up with your left-hand index finger to type the number '4'. Practice typing the number sequences.
description: Number 1, 2, 3, 4, 5

instruction: Reach up with your right-hand index finger to type the number '6'. Practice typing the number sequences.
Reach up with your right-hand index finger to type the number '7'. Practice typing the number sequences.
Reach up with your right-hand middle finger to type the number '8'. Practice typing the number sequences.

description: Capital Letters
instruction: So far, lessons have used lower case characters only.  New lessons will use upper case letters as well.  Upper case letters are typed by holding down a Shift key at the same time the letter is pressed. There are two Shift keys, one for each hand.  Hold the Shift key down with the little finger of one hand and type the letter with the correct finger on the other hand. For example. To typ an upper case 'E', press the Shift key on the rightr side of the keyboard with the right little finger. While holding the Shift key down, press the 'E' key with the left middle finger.
